alert.note: Alert for Bexar; Comal (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 4:15PM CDT until May 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bexar, Comal and Guadalupe. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, Schertz, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Selma, San Antonio Int Airport, Randolph AFB, Fair Oaks Ranch, Windcrest, Bulverde, Garden Ridge, Shavano Park, Hollywood Park, Cross Mountain, St. Hedwig, Marion, Santa Clara, Timberwood Park and The Dominion. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
